mods.abstract: TEN DOLLARS REWARD. RAN AWAY, on the 26th of July last, the Negro Woman ELIZA< about 5 feet 2 inches high; about 50 years old ; is potted across the nose by small pox ; has lost her upper front teeth ; the hair on the front part of her head is quite white ; walks fast, and holds herself erect. She was in the habit of going out to work on Baronue, COmmon, Circus, St. John and St. Paul streets ; also, in the neighborhood of the Gas Works. The above reward will be paid to any person who shall arrest her, or cause her to be arrested .... All persons are cautioned not to harbor the said slave. W. B. VERNET. 97 Camp st. au21 15t*
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
